attributes.action: Reform Air Passenger Duty to tax aircraft emissions, thus encouraging aircraft technology developments and prevent penalising UK air travellers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For politicians to be more proactive when it comes to flying and climate change. They should be encouraging people to fly in cleaner aircraft - just like they advocate for cars.
It is time to ban the oldest, dirtiest aircraft in the sky. It would be easy to do and would have a big impact.
It is wrong to tax families but not private jets and cargo. Air Passenger Duty should be reformed to tax aircraft emissions - those that pollute the most should pay the most. UK air travellers already pay more tax than any other country in Europe.

Air travel could be 50% cleaner within 10 years.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Reform Air Passenger Duty to tax aircraft emissions, thus encouraging aircraft technology developments and prevent penalising UK air travellers."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
